snippet: A record 53,615 people slept in shelters in January, according to the Coalition for the Homeless, which is hopeful Mayor Bill de Blasio will reverse a trend of rising homelessness it blames on his predecessor.
abstract: Coalition for the Homeless, nonprofit advocacy group, reports number of homeless people staying overnight in New York City shelters reached a dismal record of 53,615 in January; group is pressing Mayor Bill de Blasio to follow through on promises to undo policies that it says drove city’s homeless population to skyrocket in the first place.
lead_paragraph: A record 53,615 people slept in shelters in January, according to the Coalition for the Homeless, which is hopeful Mayor Bill de Blasio will reverse a trend of rising homelessness it blames on his predecessor.

headline.main: As Homeless Shelter Population Rises, Advocates Push Mayor on Policies
